review: I got sat at a comfortable booth with a fantastic view of the dish room. Instead of reading my book during my meal, I watched the servers pre bus their tables and throw away leftover burgers and fries. The manager also had some entertaining discussions while rushing around next to my table.  I ordered the bleu burger. Like the photo in the menu, I was expecting large crumbles of bleu cheese covering my burger with a spicy chipolte mayo and fried onions. The burger itself was delicious. However, the kosher salt like sprinkling of bleu cheese was disappointing. Why even call it a bleu burger? Service started out great with an immediate water refill. As soon as my burger arrived, the server handed me the bill and I never saw him again.  I noticed they now have a bar in this location. In fact, I saw my neighbor enjoying himself with a few brews.  Word on the street is the happy hour is a good time. I may be back for that, but not for a burger in the restaurant area.

My co-worker and I ate in here with an hour for lunch. Granted, we went at noon (not our choice), so it was bound to be busy. But we sat at the bar (cut out the middle man, went straight to the bartender for ordering), but it took quite a while for our entire process, anyway. Apparently, someone called off (that's what I could gather from the chatter between the staff) during a heavy lunch time.  We scarfed our food down very quickly, but from what I could tell, it was tasty, as expected from Red Robin! I had the turkey burger and added avacado slices. It was hot and ready and so was I (for the food!) The seasoned fries were as good as they usually are, as well.  I definitely wouldn't go during lunch rush hour again.

Let me start this review by saying that I love Red Robin. My fiance and I met at Red Robin and whenever we want to have a fun inexpensive date we find the nearest Red Robin eat until we're in a burger coma. So why the low review? This particular Red Robin is definitely sub par. The fries were mushy and over salted. The burgers were cooked well but if you top a piping hot burger with FROZEN vegetables and cold condiments it ruins the whole thing. The server was attentive and it was actually quiet when we went. If you want delicious Red Robin Burgers I suggest going to another location.
Been to this Red Robin twice now. The waitress the first time was ok. But the second time was great! Great food lots of fries. Got seated right away!

It took us a while to try Red Robin but when we did we were pleasantly surprised.  After a long day in the D we wanted something fast with a fun atmosphere, inside it is decorated nicely and lively.   The service was average, and the food was pretty good.  I like the Steak fires (most places do not have then) and the Blue Cheese Cheeseburger with an Onio bun was good to and better then I have had other places for sure (Logans, TGI Fridays).  The Mile High Pie dessert was pretty good, I find most desserts do not compare to the Olive Garden and Cheesecake Factory and Red Robin is no exception. We would go to a Red Robin again.

I was to meet a buddy for lunch and he gave me the wrong address.  I am lost if I can't use my GPS, so when the address turned out to be useless, I called him on the phone and asked him where I really should be.  He realized his mistake and he offered to meet me at this great place he knows and gave me that address.  So I ended up at the same Red Robin I visited last time. Well it was better and it was worse.  The burger was a bit rarer than the medium rare I ordered.  But I guess that is better than the other way around. I had a Royal Burger that includes a fried Egg, bacon cheese and more.  That too was tasty.  I tried a different kind of bun that I have not had at this chain before.  It was a Jalapeno Kaiser bun and I really liked it.  I also appreciated the frequent refills on our beverages and the offer and delivery of more nice hot fries.  We sat and munched them as we chatted. What was a bit hard to take was the cost of the meal.  We each had a burger and fires and nothing to drink other than water.  Yet the tab with tip and tax was over $ 13.00 each.  I don't mind spending that amount for a great meal at a fine place, but for a burger an fries?  I think Red Robin has drifted out of control. Yeah, I would go back, but I certainly am not rushing back.

I have worked in quite a few roles in the restaurant industry, and also dine out frequently.  I am always astonished at how friendly, accommodating, and efficient the staff is at this Red Robin restaurant in Troy. These days, there are so many people in the service industry who don't know what good service is.. who act like they are doing you a favor when you go to their restaurant or sit in their section. The staff at this Red Robin is wonderful, and I am very happy with the service and the food.. The burgers are always good, and I am very picky about my burgers. The only other place I get burgers in the area is Red Coat Tavern, so to be on the same level as them, this Red Robin deserves a lot of credit.  Keep up the good work!
Good food good drinks but service seems to suck every time!! Maby just get carry out nextime

Red Robin used to be a very popular place for my friends and I to go out to eat at in high school. Nowadays I will go a few times a year, mostly with family. I really like all of the bun and patty options available for their burgers. You can customize your sandwich with a wide variety of buns, including wheat and a lettuce wrap. You can also select your type of patty, from beef to turkey to veggie. Combined with various side options, along with the standard bottomless fries, Red Robin is usually a fine place for an easy dinner. Are their burgers mind-blowing and awesome? No. But they're consistent at what they do.

Its not often I would consider a franchise to be such a great restaurant but this place has great burgers. They also have gluten free buns for my wife. She thinks they are the best gluten free buns ever. I gave them four stars because their tap water tastes weird.

It's amazing how different locations can change.  This location is great compared to other Red Robin locations in the area.  We enjoyed the half order of wings and chips which came with 8 wings and a full plate of chips.  I think they gave us the full order for the half order price, but that's fine with me. :) The iced tea is amazing here.  They also have peach and raspberry flavored tea that tastes good as well. Food came out as ordered.  The meat was ordered well-done and was a tad undercooked, but still tasted fine - so no biggie.  Love the low carb food options here -- including the lettuce wrapped burgers and bottomless broccoli.  These options keep me coming back! This Red Robin is very clean and wasn't very busy during our visit.  The waitress was very attentive and kept the drinks refilled.  This is by far my favorite Red Robin location in the area.

My husband and I are regulars at the Red Robin in Madison Heights. The food is always good, but the noise level of the restaurant kept us from going more frequently. A friend told us to try the Troy location. We are SO glad we did. We visited last night and arrived at about 8:30. HAPPY HOUR! A pitcher of beer is $5 and 20 0z glasses are $2. With $3,$5, and $7 appetizers, you can't go wrong! Our server, Ashley, was wonderful! She was warm, friendly and pleasant. She took our drink order right away and we got our yummy onion tower appy with 2 side sauces very quickly. We both ordered burgers. Mine was the Shroom Burger and I added onion straws at no extra charge. The burger was cooked perfectly, as was my husband's, the Whiskey River BBQ burger, his favorite.  What we love about RR is their sides. Bottomless steak fries or salad or fruit or even broccoli. As much as you want, why, you can eat sides until you fall over! I love their iced tea, too, and let me tell you, they have a wedge salad as an appy that will blow your mind! F or $3 it is such a deal!! Sometimes, I order a bowl of French onion soup and the wedge salad. For $8, it is more than a bargain!! Ask about their burger club. If you order 9 burgers, your 10th is free. They add up fast and you get to choose any burger on the menu for free! Also, you get a free burger on your birthday! How can you go wrong!  In addition, we sat on the bar side of the restaurant. It is way more quiet than the other side. We had a wonderfully relaxing evening, drank good beer, ate great food and watched the Tiger ball game! A slice of Heaven, for sure!

I've liked Red Robin in the past, don't go often but today decided to give this location a shot. My server is what really brought down the whole meal. She said she's get me a refill, then took care of two other tables, someone else brought our meal, and I had to share my dates drink at one point. It was a really long wait to order, to get the bill, everything. My date got a burger with the extra 1.50 for onion rings, his whole plate had 5, not good portions. My cod was bland, but the steak fries were good in my fish and chips meal. I also got a berry lemonade, which was really good, but the way the glass is shaped and all the ice packed in it was nothing for $5. We ended up paying $40 for our meal, and couldn't wait to get out the door. He really liked the burger though, and the decor is nice.

Have dined at this Red Robin in the past several times, however this was first time with our sleeping 5 month old.  Went here to watch Sat night college football after a long day.  Would not let us sit in booths in "bar" area as we had a child and all the tables in other area you can't see TVs.  Additionally, main area we would have to wait.  Stated corporate policy.  Understand kids and do realize we have to make life changes, but our kid can't walk nor talk.  Even talked to Manager, but no go.  Waitress we knew was "shocked". We are now at BW3s with now issues.

Loved our trip to rr. Our server was very nice and slid in jokes here and there to make our first visit easy.  Our daughter loved her to. And kept stealing her pens whenever she (TOmmi) came over. They both just laughed.  The DGB she suggested was super amazing. Will definitely be back for the burger and request our super nice server :)  Thank you rr. It was amazing :)

The last couple visits to this Red Robin have been very disappointing with less than average service, mistaken orders and slow to get drunk refills.  Although Red Robin is typically impressive, this particular location falls well below the expectation.  Quick tip - If you haven't already tried their chicken, I recommend the sandwich while my wife prefers the chicken wrap.

I have given this restaurant its last shot, I am done. Subpar service and what good is bottemless fries when they come out undercooked and soggy multiple times in a row and you don't get to eat them with your meal. I have talked to management and was told each time it would be addressed. I am through will never spend another of my dollars here again. Going to Fuddruckers.

I think Red Robin is pretty good.  he endless fries are fun but lets be honest, who asks for another order?  I like the variety of burgers and you can build your own so that helps!  Worth it, never a wait for a table either.  i would say, eat there, don't get it to go.

Chain burger joint that neither impresses nor disappoints.  Burgers are their focus, and there are many from which to choose. Had the Banzai Burger and it was decent, although impossible to eat without a fork and knife.  Upgraded to the sweet potato fries and they were underwhelming.  Beer selection could use a boost to keep up with the popularity of craft beers.  Servers were friendly and attentive.   The one negative thing that sticks out is their menu -- it is the most confusing spiral bound collection of laminated pages I have ever seen.  Be prepared to spend 10 minutes trying to figure out what your options are! Lots of TVs throughout the bar and the dining rooms, so it's a good place to catch a game on TV.

I was there for dinner last night.. it's wasn't the greatest. The first fries we got were cold. I bit into something hard in my burger.. the second batch of fries were good and hot.. I could have went somewhere else to get a burger that was just as expensive. Definitely not the best burger for the price.

Good drink. Great waitress. Cold hamburger. and cold grilled chicken sandwich. Offered to replace food  but had event to attend. Famous for hamburger and can't even serve it warm let alone hot‼.   Not good‼.  First and last time there.

I think the food is good. The service is horrible in my opinion. One time the totally forgot my food. Another time our waitress forgot our extra fries and came 30 minutes late. And they didn't have anybody to sing happy birthday to me.

WARNING!!!!  Do not go to Red Robin on 13 Mile and John R., they have a waiter working there who is a THIEF!!!  I had dinner with my husband and son on Saturday and when I got home I realized my phone was missing.  I quickly sent my husband back to get it knowing I left it on the table.  My husband asked our waiter Cody if he saw our phone but he quickly dismissed my husband and said he had not.  Our find my iPhone app clearly showed the phone in the restaurant.  Next morning the find my phone app showed my phone at a location in Highland Park, down to a specific address.  I went back to Red Robin and asked the manager if he could confirm the address was that of my waiter Cody and it was.  Cody still denied he took my phone and I am not going to knock on his door in Highland Park for it.  He was not fired and to all staff and patrons of this Red Robins, WATCH YOUR BELONGINGS AND CASH TIPS LEFT ON THE TABLE!!!  CODY THE WAITER IS A THIEF!!!!!

The food is standard, the service is awful. Even when calling ahead for a carry out on a limited lunch break, food is never ready on time. My coworker and I tried this place out for lunch a couple of times because it's so close to our office but we wasted our entire lunch waiting for our order to be taken. Would not recommend it unless you're willing to wait hours for your food.

Wasn't too happy with our latest visit here. Our server Kendra was great, the food notsomuch. My burger was no more than a patty still a little cold, it came out plain on a plate though I'd asked to be wrapped in lettuce. They then took it back and just threw lettuce on top of it, there was no sauce on my prime chophouse burger either, and the gourmet sautéed mushrooms were raw. Needless to say I was disappointed with the food, but we did like out waitress

Rough experience as usual! We haven't been to this location in a while....tonight reminded us why. Normally it's not all of the issues listed.... 1.  It's was busy I will admit that, but the server was MIA a majority of time. 2: Appetizer COLD 2. Food was cold and wrong. I can't comprehend this! It was so busy, how is the food cold!? 3. No manager on the floor to help servers or walk around and fix customer issues. (We did not complain because we were already there 1hr and 45 min but 3 tables around us complained directly to server)  4. The bathrooms were disgusting!! I have no more words to explain. 5. The kids meal apples smelled horrible! Like mildew. Don't waste your time!

Not too bad for a Red Robin trying to keep up in a business district. I went on my lunch hour and as usual, it was extremely busy, so they did their best. My BBQ Chicken Wrap came out only slightly above average in temperature but it was still delicious. Onion Rings, BBQ Chicken Wrap, and a Freckled Lemonade....was pretty delicious for lunch.
There's no other place our family would rather have Sunday lunch than at this RR location!  They bring you more fries than you can humanly eat!!!! For the BEST service, ask for Bret or Jena!!

I appreciate that Red Robin has gluten free buns!  The staff is actually knowledgable about about food allergies and they take extra precautions in the kitchen to ensure food safety.  And let's face it, who doesn't loved a bottomless basket of fries?!

I reallyyyy want to give this place a 2/5 review or 2.5/5 but I'm going to be nice and round up to 3. Red Robin, you GOT RID OF YOUR GARLIC PARMESAN FRIES. They were SO good. And then you tricked me by including "garlic fries" on the menu, which tasted like fries sprinkled with garlic powder and some cheese haphazardly thrown in. I asked my waitress if RR still makes the garlic parmesan one, and she said no, because they don't have the garlic butter that was on the fries anymore.  So I've only been to this RR once even though it's right by me, and there's good reasons for that. Last time I went I gave it 4/5 stars, which was 2 years ago, but I don't remember it being remarkable at all. This time, some out-of-town friends were here who like RR and I had a free birthday sandwich too, so I figured, why not. I ordered the teriyaki chicken sandwich with no lettuce, mayo, or cheese. (therefore, it still has the pineapple, teriyaki sauce, and tomato) My sandwich came out with cheese, sans tomato. I picked off the cheese. The "new" garlic fries are meh. To be fair, I'm not a steak fries fan in general (bottomless fries would be pretty cool at RR otherwise) but I used to LOVE their garlic parmesan fries. The new ones taste like they have a sprinkling of garlic and that's it.  It was happy hour and the waitress went over some specials with me. My table ordered the short stack of onion rings, which on the menu said $5, and I swear she said that it was on sale during HH ... but on the bill, it came up as $5. I asked about it and she said that was the HH price ... um, okay. The only reason I'm giving this RR 3 stars instead of 2 is that my sandwich was still tasty, and overall the service was good - my water glass was always refilled. However, I will continue going to the Commerce Twp. one instead, which I like much better.
Great place! Amazing food and awesome service! I would totally visit again. How could you not love the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade?!

I went here with my 5 year old daughter on a Saturday about 5:00, and it was great. We got sat right away in a cozy booth across from the kitchen. The restaurant appeared clean and lively. The waitress was young and couldn't have been too experience but she was perfectly attentive and on time. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and fries, my daughter ordered a burger off of the kids menu with a salad, and we both could not have been more pleased. Prior to our meal we shared a cup of chili that was topped with cheese and tortilla strips and it was great! All in all I was extremely pleased and the prices is just right. I will most certainly be back to this friendly local place.

The place was very busy with lots of kids. The service was fine but the food was awful. I ordered a patty melt. There were no grilled onions on it but we had waited and said it was fine. Not even. The bread on the outside was so hard you could hardly bite into it. The garlic fries were covered in grease. I have been here before but this was the last time for a while before I go back.
The best Red Robin in the area. Staff is friendly and great. Come here weekly. Like that it is the old model restaurant and that it is kid friendly vs. the new style Red Robin.

Great food large verity of burgers great staff great location if u are into burgers this will be a good place the buns come out cold so if u are a person who likes everything worm don't forget to mention it enjoy :D

Lunchtime today!  Was ok. Friend had a chicken sandwich and a coke. I opted for lunch value burger with endless fries and a draft beer. Now I know why they offer endless fries. Not very good at all. Burger was good. Didn't really think it was worth $30 including tip though.

We often meet for lunch or early supper here because of the great location off I75 and Crooks in Troy. I don't usually review chain restaurants because most diners know them well. But at this location the table and food service are inconsistent quality for a chain. This means sometimes the burgers are not cooked as requested. Sometimes they don't ask. The burgers are always different. Sometimes they aren't as described on the menu. Sometimes the fries are soggy. Sometimes the fried cod fish is raw in center. Sometimes your server is MIA. Once we were seated at the bar and had to make a big deal because the bartender was supposed to be our server and no one told her that. Then again, sometimes all is acceptable.

My first time at red robin. It was really good but I guess I was expecting... more? The burger was in fact delicious and the service was great. The fries were particularly good with their campfire sauce. I ordered the irish shake and it was just ok... not great. Probably wouldn't get it again. Over it's just fine. I'd rather go to steak and shake.

I'm giving 5 stars because of our server, Jake.  Friendly, professional, knowledgeable and funny!  He had a huge smile and seemed genuine. Too many servers are just phoning it in but he was definitely engaged in the service experience.    He introduced himself, pointed out features and didn't seemed disappointed when we ordered water but rather offered lemon.  Jake made sure to tell us everything that comes on the burger to make sure we wanted it all ... I heard him do the same at other tables.  The food was fine, the same as all the other RR I've been to so I feel the difference is the people.   The hostesses were friendly on the way in and the way out.   Not one complaint for the entire experience.

Table was dirty. Floor was covered in food. Waitress started off okay, but after we got our food, I had to track her down to get the check. My family had left and I was sitting waiting for the bill in my jacket. She went to 2 tables by me and not mine. Pub mac'n'cheese was bland and luke warm.

Hello Red Robin. It has been a while. I got the lone star burger which has avocado, salsa, pickles and I added buffalo sauce. Also got a margarita to wash it all down. This time I really enjoyed my burger last time I was displeased and took a long break after the disappointment. But I'm glad I decided to do RR to carb up after my amateur gym session.

So I decided to come in here as they offer a free burger any day during the month of your birthday. They don't allow you to choose from the specialty burgers but the selection is pretty wide so there are a lot of things to fit your taste. I went with the Blue Ribbon which comes with blue cheese crumbles, onion straws, chipotle aioli, steak sauce and on an onion bun. I did like the burger as it was something that I had never tried before. I wouldn't say it was a knock out burger but for my first time at Red Robin and for free I couldn't complain. One cool feature is that the fries are refillable which is nice if your hungry and lite on cash but overall I wouldn't recommend Red Robin the food quality is very subpar and for the price you may as well go to another chain.

My husband and I received excellent service and food today at lunch. The bartender, Anne, was very attentive and quickly took care of us. My chicken tender salad was delicious and my husband loved the burger and fries that he ate. We will definitely return to this location.
The spaghetti is just bland noodles with tomato paste.                                                                                 Don't get it

Had a good experience here at lunch today.  Got the sriracha tavern burger and it was yummy.  Fries are just okay.  Our waitress Lauren was very attentive and sweet, despite the fact that she was very busy with a large party.
Fries were cold. Second batch was burnt. Waitress brought coke instead of diet coke. Burger was not assembled to quality level of 15 dollar burger. Give me McDonald's or Burger king.
Love all the options for bottomless sides and ease of substitution for your patty, bun, etc. service is fast and friendly for my lunch breaks. Chicken tortilla soup is amazing.

Went here tonight for a mini "date night" and was very pleased! The restaurant had looked to have been remodeled and was very bright and clean. Our waitress was great! She was on top of everything, making sure we never had empty drinks (which is huge to us). But most importantly they cooked my husbands burger correctly! He is very particular in the way he likes it cooked and no matter where we go (even burger joints) they never seem to get it quiet right. Definitely earned 5 stars in my book, they saved me from listening to him complain all night! Lol

The fact that i can only place a pickup order 15 mins in advanced is very annoying. Why cant i call at 12:30 for a pickup at 2? All i get back is "you need to call back at 1:45". No other restaurant ia like this.
This is my second time at a Red Robin restaurant.  Both times both the food and the service were great!!

The whole point of this place is the bottomless fries. So when they fail to promptly replenish the fries, it takes away any reason this place should exist. We have really tried to like this place.  First visit several months ago: Order burgers, which come out with a few fries. We immediately ask for more fries, but they don't appear until after we are already done with our burgers. Second visit today: same as above.  Do we need to come back here for $10 - $15 burgers? No.

good place for a kids birthday. it is what it is,  burgers and fries. we came with a group of about 14. our service was good, and there were at least 3 other birthdays during our visit. don't come looking for a huge variety of healthy options. i love the speckled lemonade. i will likely only come back if i am invited to another kids birthday for some reason. i would not choose this restaurant on my own.

Really enjoyed my visit!  I will note, however, that my meal was not during  what would be considered the "lunch" hours of the surrounding office buildings.  Prompt service, gracious server and an unbelievably good burger and fries.
